title: How to Remove a Coffee Stain from Carpet

steps.title: Try lemon juice.
steps.content: Try lemon juice. Add two cups (473 mL) lukewarm water and ¼ cup (59 mL) of lemon juice to a bucket or bowl. Swirl or agitate to solution to mix it fully. Fresh squeezed lemon juice is best. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mix vinegar and dish soap.
steps.content: Mix vinegar and dish soap. [2] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. Add one tablespoon (14.8 mL) of dish soap, one tablespoon (14.8 mL) of white vinegar, and two cups (473 mL) warm water to a bucket. Agitate the solution to ensure it is fully mixed. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use club soda.
steps.content: Use club soda. Be sure to choose a club soda without any additional flavoring or color. You can pour a small amount of club soda directly on the stain, or transfer the club soda to a spray bottle and spritz it on the stain. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove excess moisture first.
steps.content: Remove excess moisture first. Apply paper towels to the stain to absorb as much of the coffee as possible. Don’t rub the stain, or it may spread. Gently press the paper towels into the carpet to soak up the coffee. You can also use a clean, absorbent towel if you wish. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Test the solution on an inconspicuous area.
steps.content: Test the solution on an inconspicuous area. To be sure the cleaning solution won’t fade the color of your carpet, test a small amount of the solution on a small area. Apply the solution and wait 20 minutes. Check the spot for color changes. If there is a negative reaction, try a different cleaning solution.

steps.title: Apply the solution to your carpet.
steps.content: Apply the solution to your carpet. [6] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. Use a clean towel dipped in the cleaning solution. Press the towel onto the stained area. Frequently change the area of towel you are using, or get a clean towel, to ensure you aren’t further dirtying the carpet. Be sure to get the entire stain, including the edges and any errant drops. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Blot the wet area.
steps.content: Blot the wet area. Gently press down on the carpet with a clean, dry towel. Use the towel to remove the stain and any excess moisture from your carpet. Use a clean portion of the towel each time. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Flush the area with water.
steps.content: Flush the area with water. This removes the cleaning solution from your carpet as well as ensures all the coffee is removed. Pour warm water directly onto the area, or dip a clean towel in water and apply it to your carpet. [9] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. You could also spray the area using a spray bottle filled with water. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Remove excess moisture.
steps.content: Remove excess moisture. Blot the entire area to remove as much water as possible. Use a clean towel to press down on your carpet and soak up the moisture. [11] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. Be sure to frequently change the towel for maximum absorbency. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the carpet to dry.
steps.content: Allow the carpet to dry. Place a clean towel over the wet area. Cover the towel with a plastic bag and place a heavy item on top. You can use a heavy pan, paper weight, or other item. Leave the weight on for several hours to allow the towel to soak up the moisture. Remove the weight, bag, and towel, then allow the area to fully air dry.
